types.description: An object containing information about the script context that sent a message or request.

tab.description: This property will only be present when the connection was opened from a tab or content script.

id.description: The extension ID of the extension that opened the connection.

types.description: An object which allows the addition and removal of listeners for a Chrome event.
An object which allows two way communication with other pages.

sender.description: This property will only be present on ports passed to onConnect/onConnectExternal listeners.

lastError.description: Set for the lifetime of a callback if an ansychronous extension api has resulted in an error. If no error has occured lastError will be <var>undefined</var>.

message.description: Description of the error that has taken place.

inIncognitoContext.description: True for content scripts running inside incognito tabs, and for extension pages running inside an incognito process. The latter only applies to extensions with 'split' incognito_behavior.

message.description: True if the page or script is in an incongito process.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Attempts to connect to other listeners within the extension (such as the extension's background page). This is primarily useful for content scripts connecting to their extension processes. Extensions may connect to content scripts embedded in tabs via chrome.tabs.connect().

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The extension ID of the extension you want to connect to. If omitted, default is your own extension.

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for extension processes that are listening for the connection event.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received with the extension. The port's onDisconnect event is fired if extension does not exist.

functions.name: sendRequest
functions.description: Sends a single request to other listeners within the extension. Similar to chrome.extension.connect, but only sends a single request with an optional response. The chrome.extension.onRequest event is fired in each page of the extension.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The extension ID of the extension you want to connect to. If omitted, default is your own extension.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the request. If an error occurs while connecting to the extension, the callback will be called with no arguments and chrome.extension.lastError will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: getViews
functions.description: Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the pages running inside the current extension.

type.description: The type of view to get. If omitted, returns all views (including background pages and tabs). Valid values: 'tab', 'infobar', 'notification', 'popup'.

windowId.description: The window to restrict the search to. If omitted, returns all views.

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Returns the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension. Returns null if the extension has no background page.

functions.name: getToolstrips
functions.description: Deprecated. Please use getViews({type: 'TOOLSTRIP'}). Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the toolstrip views running inside the current extension. If windowId is specified, returns only the 'window' objects of toolstrips attached to the specified window.

functions.name: getExtensionTabs
functions.description: Deprecated. Please use getViews({type: 'TAB'}). Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the tabs running inside the current extension. If windowId is specified, returns only the 'window' objects of tabs attached to the specified window.

functions.name: setUpdateUrlData
functions.description: Sets the value of the ap CGI parameter used in the extension's update URL.  This value is ignored for extensions that are hosted in the Chrome Extension Gallery.

events.name: onConnect
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script.

events.name: onConnectExternal
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from another extension.

events.name: onRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response.

events.name: onRequestExternal
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from another extension.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response.

types.description: Parent class for accessibility information about an object.

type.description: The type of this object, which determines the contents of 'details'.

name.description: The localized name of the object, like OK or Password. Do not rely on an exact string match because the text will be in the user's language and may change in the future.

details.description: Other details like the state, depending on the type of object.

types.description: Information about the state of a checkbox.

isChecked.description: True if this checkbox is checked.

types.description: Information about the state of a combo box.

value.description: The value of the combo box.

itemCount.description: The number of items in the combo box's list.

itemIndex.description: The 0-based index of the current value, or -1 if the user entered a value not from the list.

types.description: Information about the state of a list box.

value.description: The value of the list box.

itemCount.description: The number of items in the list.

itemIndex.description: The 0-based index of the selected value, or -1 if no items are selected.

types.description: Information about the state of a drop-down menu.
Information about a menu item.

hasSubmenu.description: True if this item opens a submenu.

itemCount.description: The number of items in the menu.

itemIndex.description: The 0-based index of this menu item.

types.description: Information about the state of a radio button.

isChecked.description: True if this radio button is checked.

itemCount.description: The number of radio buttons in this group.

itemIndex.description: The 0-based index of this radio button in this group.

types.description: Additional accessibility information about a tab.

itemCount.description: The number of tabs in this group.

itemIndex.description: The 0-based index of this tab in this group.

types.description: Information about the state of a text box.

value.description: The value of the text box - the entered text.

isPassword.description: True if this control contains password text whose contents should be obscured.

selectionStart.description: The index of the character where the selection starts, if this control contains editable text.

selectionEnd.description: The index of the character where the selection ends, if this control contains editable text.

functions.name: setAccessibilityEnabled
functions.description: Enable or disable the accessibility extension api. This must be set to true before event listeners or getFocusedControl will work.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: True if accessibility support should be enabled.

functions.name: getFocusedControl
functions.description: Get information about the currently focused control.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Details of the currently focused control, or null if nothing is focused.

events.name: onWindowOpened
events.description: Fired when a window is opened.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Information about the window that was opened.

events.name: onWindowClosed
events.description: Fired when a window is closed.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Information about the window that was closed.

events.name: onControlFocused
events.description: Fired when a control is focused.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Details of the control that was focused.

events.name: onControlAction
events.description: Fired when a control's action is taken, like pressing a button or toggling a checkbox.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Details of the control whose action was taken.

events.name: onTextChanged
events.description: Fired when text changes in an editable text control.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Details of the control where the text changed.

events.name: onMenuOpened
events.description: Fired when a menu is opened.

parameters.name: menu
parameters.description: Information about the menu that was opened.

events.name: onMenuClosed
events.description: Fired when a menu is closed.

parameters.name: menu
parameters.description: Information about the menu that was closed.

functions.name: getPopupView
functions.description: Returns a reference to the JavaScript 'window' object of the popup view.  Returns undefined if no popup presently shown.

functions.name: speak
functions.description: Speak text using a text-to-speech engine.

parameters.name: utterance
parameters.description: The text to speak.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The speak options. This parameter is currently ignored.

enqueue.description: If true, enqueues this utterance if TTS is already in progress. If false (the default), interrupts any current speech and flushes the speech queue before speaking this new utterance.

voiceName.description: The name of the voice to use for synthesis.

locale.description: The language and region code that specify the language and dialect to be used for synthesis, in the form <language>-<region>, e.g. en-US, en-GB, fr-CA, zh-CN, etc.

gender.description: Gender of voice for synthesized speech.

rate.description: Speaking speed between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being slowest and 1 being fastest.

pitch.description: Speaking pitch between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest.

volume.description: Speaking volume between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: This function is called when speaking is finished.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stop any current speech.

functions.name: isSpeaking
functions.description: Check if the engine is currently speaking.

parameters.name: speaking
parameters.description: True if speaking, false otherwise.

functions.name: speakCompleted
functions.description: A callback passed to the onSpeak event.

events.name: onSpeak
events.description: Called when the user makes a call to tts.speak and the options matches one of the tts_voices from this extension's manifest.

parameters.name: utterance
parameters.description: The text to speak.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The speak options.

voiceName.description: The name of the voice to use for synthesis.

locale.description: The language and region code that specify the language and dialect to be used for synthesis, in the form <language>-<region>, e.g. en-US, en-GB, fr-CA, zh-CN, etc.

gender.description: Gender of voice for synthesized speech.

rate.description: Speaking speed between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being slowest and 1 being fastest.

pitch.description: Speaking pitch between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest.

volume.description: Speaking volume between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: You must call this function when speaking is finished.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: Error message, which will be returned to the caller in chrome.extension.lastError.

events.name: onStop
events.description: Fired when a call is made to tts.stop and this extension may be in the middle of speaking.

id.description: The ID of the window. Window IDs are unique within a browser session.

focused.description: Whether the window is currently the focused window.

top.description: The offset of the window from the top edge of the screen in pixels.

left.description: The offset of the window from the left edge of the screen in pixels.

width.description: The width of the window in pixels.

height.description: The height of the window in pixels.

tabs.description: Array of $ref:Tab objects representing the current tabs in the window.

type.description: The type of browser window this is.

WINDOW_ID_NONE.description: The windowId value that represents the absence of a chrome browser window.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets details about a window.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the current window.

functions.name: getLastFocused
functions.description: Gets the window that was most recently focused — typically the window 'on top'.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets all windows.

populate.description: If true, each window object will have a <var>tabs</var> property that contains a list of the $ref:Tab objects for that window.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates (opens) a new browser with any optional sizing, position or default URL provided.

url.description: A URL or list of URLs to open as tabs in the window. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to adopt to the new window.

left.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the left edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focusd window.

top.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the top edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focusd window.

width.description: The width in pixels of the new window. If not specified defaults to a natural width.

height.description: The height in pixels of the new window. If not specified defaults to a natural height.

incognito.description: Whether the new window should be an incognito window.

type.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the created window.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the properties of a window. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged.

left.description: The offset from the left edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels.

top.description: The offset from the top edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels.

width.description: The width to resize the window to in pixels.

height.description: The height to resize the window to in pixels.

focused.description: It true, brings the window to the front. If false, brings the next window in the z-order to the front.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes (closes) a window, and all the tabs inside it.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a window is created.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Details of the window that was created.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a window is removed (closed).

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the removed window.

events.name: onFocusChanged
events.description: Fired when the currently focused window changes. Will be chrome.windows.WINDOW_ID_NONE if all chrome windows have lost focus. Note: On some Linux window managers, WINDOW_ID_NONE will always be sent immediately preceding a switch from one chrome window to another.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the newly focused window.

id.description: The ID of the tab. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session.

index.description: The zero-based index of the tab within its window.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the tab is contained within.

url.description: The URL the tab is displaying.

title.description: The title of the tab. This may not be available if the tab is loading.

favIconUrl.description: The URL of the tab's favicon. This may not be available if the tab is loading.

incognito.description: Whether the tab is in an incognito window.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified tab.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the tab that this script call is being made from. May be undefined if called from a non-tab context (for example: a background page or popup view).

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Connects to the content script(s) in the specified tab. The chrome.extension.onConnect event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension. For more details, see Content Script Messaging.

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for content scripts that are listening for the connection event.

returns.description: A port that can be used to communicate with the content scripts running in the specified tab. The port's onDisconnect event is fired if the tab closes or does not exist.

functions.name: sendRequest
functions.description: Sends a single request to the content script(s) in the specified tab, with an optional callback to run when a response is sent back. The chrome.extension.onRequest event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the request. If an error occurs while connecting to the specified tab, the callback will be called with no arguments and chrome.extension.lastError will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getSelected
functions.description: Gets the tab that is selected in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the current window.

functions.name: getAllInWindow
functions.description: Gets details about all tabs in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the current window.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new tab. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'tabs' permission in the manifest.

windowId.description: The window to create the new tab in. Defaults to the current window.

index.description: The position the tab should take in the window. The provided value will be clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

url.description: The URL to navigate the tab to initially. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e. 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs will be relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

selected.description: Whether the tab should become the selected tab in the window. Defaults to <var>true</var>

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned. Defaults to <var>false</var>

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the created tab. Will contain the ID of the new tab.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a tab. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'tabs' permission in the manifest.

url.description: A URL to navigate the tab to.

selected.description: Whether the tab should be selected.

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the updated tab.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves a tab to a new position within its window, or to a new window. Note that tabs can only be moved to and from normal (window.type === "normal") windows.

windowId.description: Defaults to the window the tab is currently in.

index.description: The position to move the window to. The provided value will be clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the moved tab.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Closes a tab.

functions.name: detectLanguage
functions.description: Detects the primary language of the content in a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. The 2nd to 4th columns will be checked and the first non-NULL value will be returned except for Simplified Chinese for which zh-CN will be returned. For an unknown language, und will be returned.

functions.name: captureVisibleTab
functions.description: Captures the visible area of the currently selected tab in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The target window. Defaults to the current window.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Set parameters of image capture, such as the format of the resulting image.

format.description: The format of the resulting image.  Default is jpeg.

quality.name: quality
quality.description: When format is 'jpeg', controls the quality of the resulting image.  This value is ignored for PNG images.  As quality is decreased, the resulting image will have more visual artifacts, and the number of bytes needed to store it will decrease.

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: A data URL which encodes an image of the visible area of the captured tab. May be assigned to the 'src' property of an HTML Image element for display.

functions.name: executeScript
functions.description: Injects JavaScript code into a page. For details, see the programmatic injection section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to run the script; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the script to run. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, this function injects script into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and script is injected only into the top main frame.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after all the JavaScript has been executed.

functions.name: insertCSS
functions.description: Injects CSS into a page. For details, see the programmatic injection section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to insert the CSS; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to insert. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, this function injects CSS text into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and CSS is injected only into the top main frame.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when all the CSS has been inserted.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fires when a tab is created. Note that the tab's URL may not be set at the time this event fires, but you can listen to onUpdated events to be notified when a URL is set.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details of the tab that was created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fires when a tab is updated.

parameters.name: changeInfo
parameters.description: Lists the changes to the state of the tab that was updated.

status.description: The status of the tab. Can be either loading or complete.

url.description: The tab's URL if it has changed.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Gives the state of the tab that was updated.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fires when a tab is moved within a window. Only one move event is fired, representing the tab the user directly moved. Move events are not fired for the other tabs that must move in response. This event is not fired when a tab is moved between windows. For that, see onDetached.

events.name: onSelectionChanged
events.description: Fires when the selected tab in a window changes.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab that has become selected.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the selected tab changed inside of.

events.name: onDetached
events.description: Fired when a tab is detached from a window, for example because it is being moved between windows.

events.name: onAttached
events.description: Fired when a tab is attached to a window, for example because it was moved between windows.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fires when a tab is closed.

isWindowClosing.description: True when the tab is being closed because its window is being closed.

functions.name: enableForTab
functions.description: Enables a page action for a particular tab+URL combination (makes its icon visible in the OmniBox when a certain URL is active in a given tab). The page action will automatically be disabled (its icon hidden) if the user navigates to a new URL or closes the tab. The action will also automatically be enabled/disabled as the user switches tabs.

parameters.name: pageActionId
parameters.description: An extension can have multiple page actions specified in the manifest, each with a unique identifier. This string identifies which page action you want to enable (and must match a page action id declared in the manifest).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: An object specifing what action should be applied to the page action. Contains the following properties:

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to enable the page action.

url.description: The URL of the page you want the page action to apply to. If the URL specified does not match the currently navigated URL (user has navigated to another page) then no action is taken.

title.description: Specifying title allows you to change the tooltip that appears when you hover over the page action icon in the OmniBox. This parameter is optional and if omitted then the page action name property declared in the manifest is used.

iconId.description: A zero-based index into the icons vector specified in the manifest. This parameter is optional and if omitted then the first icon in the icons vector of the page action is used. This id is useful to represent different page action states. Example: An RSS feed icon could have a 'subscribe now' icon and an 'already subscribed' icon.

functions.name: disableForTab
functions.description: Disables a page action for a particular tab+URL combination (makes its OmniBox page action icon hidden when a certain URL is active in a given tab). This can be useful to disable a page action before the user navigates away from a page containing an enabled page action.

parameters.name: pageActionId
parameters.description: An extension can have multiple page actions specified in the manifest, each with a unique identifier. This string identifies which page action you want to disable (and must match a page action id declared in the manifest).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: An object specifying what action should be applied to the page action. Contains the following properties:

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to disable the page action.

url.description: The URL of the page you want the page action to not apply to. If the URL specified does not match the currently navigated URL (user has navigated to another page) then no action is taken.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows the page action. The page action is shown whenever the tab is selected.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides the page action.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the page action. This is displayed in a tooltip over the page action.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the page action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

imageData.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

path.description: Relative path to an image in the extension to show in the browser action.

iconIndex.description: Deprecated. The zero-based index into the icons vector specified in the manifest.

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the page action's icon.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a page action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the page action has a popup.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the browser action. This shows up in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the browser action should display when moused over.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the browser action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

path.description: Relative path to an image in the extension to show in the browser action.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the browser action's icon.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

popup.description: The html file to show in a popup.  If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets the badge text for the browser action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255].

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a browser action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the browser action has a popup.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows an infobar in the specified tab. The infobar will be closed automatically when the tab navigates. Use window.close() to close the infobar before then.

tabId.description: The tab id for the tab to display the infobar in.

path.description: The html file that contains the infobar.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the window in which the infobar was created.

types.description: A node (either a bookmark or a folder) in the bookmark tree.  Child nodes are ordered within their parent folder.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the browser is restarted.

parentId.description: The id of the parent folder. Omitted for the root node.

index.description: The 0-based position of this node within its parent folder.

url.description: The URL navigated to when a user clicks the bookmark. Omitted for folders.

title.description: The text displayed for the node.

dateAdded.description: When this node was created, in milliseconds since the epoch (new Date(dateAdded)).

dateGroupModified.description: When the contents of this folder last changed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

children.description: An ordered list of children of this node.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves the specified BookmarkTreeNode(s).

parameters.name: idOrIdList
parameters.description: A single string-valued id, or an array of string-valued ids

functions.name: getChildren
functions.description: Retrieves the children of the specified BookmarkTreeNode id.

functions.name: getRecent
functions.description: Retrieves the recently added bookmarks.

parameters.name: numberOfItems
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

functions.name: getTree
functions.description: Retrieves the entire Bookmarks hierarchy.

functions.name: search
functions.description: Searches for BookmarkTreeNodes matching the given query.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a bookmark or folder under the specified parentId.  If url is NULL or missing, it will be a folder.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves the specified BookmarkTreeNode to the provided location.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the properties of a bookmark or folder. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged. Note: Currently, only 'title' and 'url' are supported.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a bookmark or an empty bookmark folder.

functions.name: removeTree
functions.description: Recursively removes a bookmark folder.

functions.name: import
functions.description: Imports bookmarks from a chrome html bookmark file

functions.name: export
functions.description: Exports bookmarks to a chrome html bookmark file

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is created.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is removed.  When a folder is removed recursively, a single notification is fired for the folder, and none for its contents.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder changes. Note: Currently, only title and url changes trigger this.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is moved to a different parent folder.

events.name: onChildrenReordered
events.description: Fired when the children of a folder have changed their order due to the order being sorted in the UI.  This is not called as a result of a move().

events.name: onImportBegan
events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is begun.  Expensive observers should ignore handleCreated updates until onImportEnded is fired.  Observers should still handle other notifications immediately.

events.name: onImportEnded
events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is ended.

types.description: An object encapsulating one result of a history query.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

url.description: The URL navigated to by a user.

title.description: The title of the history page.

lastVisitTime.description: When this page was last loaded, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

visitCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page.

typedCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page by typing in the address.

types.description: An object encapsulating one visit to a URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

visitId.description: The unique identifier for this visit.

visitTime.description: When this visit occurred, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

transition.description: The transition type for this visit from its referrer.

functions.name: search
functions.description: Search the history for the last visit time of each page matching the query.

text.description: A free-text query to the history service.  Leave empty to retrieve all pages.

startTime.description: Limit results to those visited after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

endTime.description: Limit results to those visited before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.  Defaults to 100.

functions.name: getVisits
functions.description: Retrieve information about visits to a URL.

url.description: The URL for which to retrieve visit information.  It must be in the format as returned from a call to history.search.

functions.name: addUrl
functions.description: Adds a URL to the history at the current time with a transition type of "link".

url.description: The URL to add.

functions.name: deleteUrl
functions.description: Removes all occurrences of the given URL from the history.

url.description: The URL to remove.

functions.name: deleteRange
functions.description: Removes all items within the specified date range from the history.  Pages will not be removed from the history unless all visits fall within the range.

startTime.description: Items added to history after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

endTime.description: Items added to history before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.name: deleteAll
functions.description: Deletes all items from the history.

events.name: onVisited
events.description: Fired when a URL is visited, providing the HistoryItem data for that URL.

events.name: onVisitRemoved
events.description: Fired when one or more URLs are removed from the history service.  When all visits have been removed the URL is purged from history.

allHistory.description: True if all history was removed.  If true, then urls will be empty.

functions.name: queryState
functions.description: Returns the current state of the browser.

parameters.name: thresholdSeconds
parameters.description: Threshold, in seconds, used to determine when a machine is in the idle state.

events.name: onStateChanged
events.description: Fired when the browser changes to an active state.  Currently only reports the transition from idle to active.

functions.name: getAcceptLanguages
functions.description: Gets the accept-languages of the browser. This is different from the locale used by the browser; to get the locale, use window.navigator.language.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Array of the accept languages of the browser, such as en-US,en,zh-CN

functions.name: getMessage
functions.description: Gets the localized string for the specified message. If the message is missing, this method returns an empty string (''). If the format of the getMessage() call is wrong — for example, messageName is not a string or the substitutions array is empty or has more than 9 elements — this method returns undefined.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message, as specified in the messages.json file.

parameters.name: substitutions
parameters.description: 1 - 9 substitution strings, if the message requires any.

functions.name: sendKeyboardEvent
functions.description: Send a keyboard event to Chrome.

parameters.name: event

altKey.description: Whether or not the ALT key is pressed.

ctrlKey.description: Whether or not the CTRL key is pressed.

metaKey.description: Whether or not the META key is pressed.

shiftKey.description: Whether or not the SHIFT key is pressed.

parameters.description: The keyboard event to be sent.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: This function is called when the event processing is completed.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Displays a pop-up window hosting an extension view.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the contents to which the pop-up will be navigated.

relativeTo.description: A HTML DOM object to which the pop-up's position will be made relative.

giveFocus.description: Pass true to give the focus to the popup window.  The default behaviour is true.

borderStyle.description: Pass 'bubble' to give the pop-up window a bubble-chrome border, including an arrow pointing at the relative-to point.  Pass 'rectangle' to give the pop-up a rectangular black border with drop-shadow.  Default behaviour is to pass 'bubble'.

width.description: The maximal width to which the popup will resize.  If not present, the popup will be no wider than 800 pixels.  The popup will widen to no larger than the minimum of the width parameter and the width of the screen.

height.description: The maximal height to which the popup will resize.  If not present, the popup will be no taller than 600 pixels.  The popup will grow to no taller than than the minimum of the height parameter and the width of the screen.

functions.name: getParentWindow
functions.description: Returns a reference to the JavaScript 'window' object of the extension view that launched the popup.  Returns undefined if called outside of a popup window.

events.name: onClosed
events.description: Fired when the popup view is closed.

id.description: The ID of the bookmark. This is only provided if the data is from the same profile.

parentId.description: The ID of the parent of the bookmark. This is only provided if the data is from the same profile.

types.description: Information about the drag and drop data for use with drag and drop events.

functions.name: copy
functions.description: Copies the given bookmarks into the clipboard

parameters.name: idList
parameters.description: An array of string-valued ids

functions.name: cut
functions.description: Cuts the given bookmarks into the clipboard

parameters.name: idList
parameters.description: An array of string-valued ids

functions.name: paste
functions.description: Pastes bookmarks from the clipboard into the parent folder

functions.name: canPaste
functions.description: Whether there are any bookmarks that can be pasted

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to paste into

functions.name: sortChildren
functions.description: Sorts the children of a given folder

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to sort the children of

functions.name: getStrings
functions.description: Gets the i18n strings for the bookmark manager

functions.name: startDrag
functions.description: Begins dragging a set of bookmarks

parameters.name: idList
parameters.description: An array of string-valued ids

functions.name: drop
functions.description: Performs the drop action of the drag and drop session

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder that the drop was made

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the position to drop at. If left out the dropped items will be placed at the end of the existing children

functions.name: getSubtree
functions.description: Retrieves a bookmark hierarchy from the given node.  If the node id is empty, it is the full tree.  If foldersOnly is true, it will only return folders, not actual bookmarks.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the root of the tree to pull.  If empty, the entire tree will be returned.

parameters.name: foldersOnly
parameters.description: Pass true to only return folders.

events.name: onDragEnter
events.description: Fired when dragging bookmarks over the document

events.name: onDragLeave
events.description: Fired when the drag and drop leaves the document

events.name: onDrop
events.description: Fired when the user drops bookmarks on the document

functions.name: getTabEvents
functions.description: Experimental support for timeline API

types.description: An object containing information about one of the browser's processes.

id.description: The ID of the process, as provided by the OS.

cpu.description: The most recent measurement of the process's CPU usage, between 0 and 100%.

network.description: The most recent measurement of the process's network usage, in bytes per second.

privateMemory.description: The most recent measurement of the process's private memory usage, in bytes.

sharedMemory.description: The most recent measurement of the process's shared memory usage, in bytes.

functions.name: getProcessIdForTab
functions.description: Returns the ID of the renderer process for the specified tab.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: Process ID of the tab's renderer process.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fires each time the Task Manager updates its process statistics, providing the dictionary of updated Process objects, indexed by process ID.

types.description: Information sent when a context menu item is clicked.

menuItemId.description: The ID of the menu item that was clicked.

parentMenuItemId.description: The parent ID, if any, for the item clicked.

mediaType.description: One of 'image', 'video', or 'audio' if the context menu was activated on one of these types of elements.

linkUrl.description: If the element is a link, the URL it points to.

srcUrl.description: Will be present for elements with a 'src' URL.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page where the menu item was clicked.

frameUrl.description: The URL of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked, if it was in a frame.

selectionText.description: The text for the context selection, if any.

editable.description: A flag indicating whether the element is editable (text input, textarea, etc.).

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in chrome.extension.lastError).

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

type.description: The type of menu item - one of 'normal', 'checkbox', 'radio', or 'separator'. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Legal values are: 'all', 'page', 'selection', 'link', 'editable', 'image', 'video', and 'audio'. Defaults to ['page'].

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place.

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see Match Patterns.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in chrome.extension.lastError.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Update a previously created context menu item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.

parameters.name: updateProperties
parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.

parentId.description: Note: You cannot change an item to be a child of one of its own descendants.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been updated.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a context menu item.

parameters.name: menuItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when the context menu has been removed.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Remove all context menu items added by this extension.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called when removal is complete.

types.description: Describes the type of metric that is to be collected.

metricName.description: A unique name within the extension for the metric.

type.description: The type of metric, such as 'histogram-log' or 'histogram-linear'.

min.description: The minimum sample value to be recoded.  Must be greater than zero.

max.description: The maximum sample value to be recoded.

buckets.description: The number of buckets to use when separating the recorded values.

functions.name: getEnabled
functions.description: Get the user preference to send UMA and crash reports to Google.

functions.name: setEnabled
functions.description: Set the user preference to send UMA and crash reports to Google.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: True for setting Chrome to actively send UMA and crash reports, false for disabling this.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: The actual value set. If it is not the one passed in parameter, the value couldn't be changed (e.g. because of security).

functions.name: recordUserAction
functions.description: Records an action performed by the user.

functions.name: recordPercentage
functions.description: Record a percentage value from 1 to 100.

functions.name: recordCount
functions.description: Record a value than can range from 1 to 1,000,000.

functions.name: recordSmallCount
functions.description: Record a value than can range from 1 to 100.

functions.name: recordMediumCount
functions.description: Record a value than can range from 1 to 10,000.

functions.name: recordTime
functions.description: Record an elapsed time of no more than 10 seconds.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordMediumTime
functions.description: Record an elapsed time of no more than 3 minutes.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordLongTime
functions.description: Record an elapsed time of no more than 1 hour.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordValue
functions.description: Adds a value to the given metric.

types.description: Represents information about an HTTP cookie.

hostOnly.description: True if the cookie is a host-only cookie (i.e. a request's host must exactly match the domain of the cookie).

secure.description: True if the cookie is marked as Secure (i.e. its scope is limited to secure channels, typically HTTPS).

httpOnly.description: True if the cookie is marked as HttpOnly (i.e. the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts).

session.description: True if the cookie is a session cookie, as opposed to a persistent cookie with an expiration date.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Not provided for session cookies.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store containing this cookie, as provided in getAllCookieStores().

types.description: Represents a cookie store in the browser. An incognito mode window, for instance, uses a separate cookie store from a non-incognito window.

id.description: The unique identifier for the cookie store.

tabIds.description: Identifiers of all the browser tabs that share this cookie store.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves information about a single cookie. If more than one cookie of the same name exists for the given URL, the one with the longest path will be returned. For cookies with the same path length, the cookie with the earliest creation time will be returned.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details to identify the cookie being retrieved.

url.description: The URL with which the cookie to retrieve is associated. This argument may be a full URL, in which case any data following the URL path (e.g. the query string) is simply ignored. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

name.description: The name of the cookie to retrieve.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to look for the cookie. By default, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie. This parameter is null if no such cookie was found.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Retrieves all cookies from a single cookie store that match the given information.  The cookies returned will be sorted, with those with the longest path first.  If multiple cookies have the same path length, those with the earliest creation time will be first.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information to filter the cookies being retrieved.

url.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those that would match the given URL.

domain.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose domains match or are subdomains of this one.

path.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose path exactly matches this string.

secure.description: Filters the cookies by their Secure property.

session.description: Filters out session vs. persistent cookies.

storeId.description: The cookie store to retrieve cookies from. If omitted, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

parameters.name: cookies
parameters.description: All the existing, unexpired cookies that match the given cookie info.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets a cookie with the given cookie data; may overwrite equivalent cookies if they exist.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details about the cookie being set.

url.description: The request-URI to associate with the setting of the cookie. This value can affect the default domain and path values of the created cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

name.description: The name of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

value.description: The value of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

domain.description: The domain of the cookie. If omitted, the cookie becomes a host-only cookie.

path.description: The path of the cookie. Defaults to the path portion of the url parameter.

secure.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as Secure. Defaults to false.

httpOnly.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as HttpOnly. Defaults to false.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to set the cookie. By default, the cookie is set in the current execution context's cookie store.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Deletes a cookie by name.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information to identify the cookie to remove.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

name.description: The name of the cookie to remove.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store to look in for the cookie. If unspecified, the cookie is looked for by default in the current execution context's cookie store.

functions.name: getAllCookieStores
functions.description: Lists all existing cookie stores.

parameters.name: cookieStores
parameters.description: All the existing cookie stores.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when a cookie is set or removed.

removed.description: True if a cookie was removed.

cookie.description: Information about the cookie that was set or removed.

functions.name: recordProductEvent
functions.description: Records an RLZ event for a given product's access point.

functions.name: getAccessPointRlz
functions.description: Gets the RLZ string to be used when accessing a Google property through the given access point.

functions.name: sendFinancialPing
functions.description: Sends Google promotional information about this extension.

functions.name: clearProductState
functions.description: Clears all product-specific RLZ state from the machine, as well as clearing all events for the specified access points.

events.name: onBeforeNavigate
events.description: Fires when a navigation is about to occur.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation is about to occur.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

requestId.description: The ID of the request to retrieve the document of this navigation. Note that this event is fired prior to the corresponding chrome.experimental.webRequest.onBeforeRequest.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to start the navigation, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCommitted
events.description: Fires when a navigation is committed. The document (and the resources it refers to, such as images and subframes) might still be downloading, but at least part of the document has been received from the server and the browser has decided to switch to the new document.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; positive value indicates navigation in a subframe.

transitionType.description: Cause of the navigation. The same transition types as defined in the history API are used.

transitionQualifiers.description: Zero or more transition qualifiers delimited by "|". Possible qualifiers are "client_redirect", "server_redirect", and "forward_back".

timeStamp.description: The time when the navigation was committed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onDOMContentLoaded
events.description: Fires when the page's DOM is fully constructed, but the referenced resources may not finish loading.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; positive value indicates navigation in a subframe.

timeStamp.description: The time when the page's DOM was fully constructed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCompleted
events.description: Fires when a document, including the resources it refers to, is completely loaded and initialized.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; positive value indicates navigation in a subframe.

timeStamp.description: The time when the document finished loading, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onErrorOccurred
events.description: Fires when an error occurs.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation occurs.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; positive value indicates navigation in a subframe.

timeStamp.description: The time when the error occurred, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onBeforeRetarget
events.description: Fires when a new window, or a new tab in an existing window, is about to be created to host a navigation.

sourceTabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation is triggered.

sourceUrl.description: The URL of the document that is opening the new window.

targetUrl.description: The URL to be opened in the new window.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to create a new view, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onBeforeRequest
events.description: Fires when a request is about to occur.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to null if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to make the request, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onRequestSent
events.description: Fires when a request is sent to the server.

ip.description: The server IP address that is actually connected to. Note that it may be a literal IPv6 address.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser finished sending the request, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onHeadersReceived
events.description: Fires when the status line and response headers are received after a request is sent to the server.

statusCode.description: Standard HTTP status code returned by the server.

timeStamp.description: The time when the status line and response headers were received, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onBeforeRedirect
events.description: Fires when a server initiated redirect is about to occur.

url.description: The URL of the current request.

statusCode.description: Standard HTTP status code returned by the server.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to make the redirect, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onCompleted
events.description: Fires when a request is completed.

url.description: The URL of the current request.

statusCode.description: Standard HTTP status code returned by the server.

timeStamp.description: The time when the response was received completely, in milliseconds since the epoch.

events.name: onErrorOccurred
events.description: Fires when an error occurs.

url.description: The URL of the current request.

timeStamp.description: The time when the error occurred, in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.name: getConfig
functions.description: Gives configuration options set by the test.

testServer.description: Details on the test server used to mock network responses.  Will be set only if test calls ExtensionApiTest::StartTestServer().

port.description: The port on which the test server is listening.

functions.name: notifyFail
functions.description: Notify the browser process that test code running in the extension failed.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: notifyPass
functions.description: Notify the browser process that test code running in the extension passed.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: resetQuota
functions.description: Reset all accumulated quota state for all extensions.  This is only used for internal unit testing.

functions.name: log
functions.description: Logs a message during internal unit testing.

functions.name: createIncognitoTab
functions.description: Creates an incognito tab during internal testing. Succeeds even if the extension is not enabled in incognito mode.

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a string message to the browser process, generating a Notification that C++ test code can wait for.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Used to test sending messages to extensions.

lastMessage.description: True if this was the last message for this test

types.description: An object encapsulating a single proxy server's specification.

scheme.description: The scheme (protocol) of the proxy server itself.

host.description: The URI of the proxy server.

port.description: The port of the proxy server.

types.description: An object encapsulating the set of proxy rules for all protocols.

singleProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for all per-URL requests (i.e., http, https, and ftp).

proxyForHttp.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTP requests.

proxyForHttps.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTPS requests.

proxyForFtp.description: The proxy server to be used for FTP requests.

socksProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for SOCKS requests.

types.description: An object holding proxy auto-config information. Only one of the fields should be non-empty.

url.description: URL of he PAC file to be used.

types.description: An object encapsulating a complete proxy configuration.

rules.description: The proxy rules describing this configuration.

pacScript.description: The proxy auto-config (PAC) script for this configuration.

mode.description:
'direct' = Never use a proxy
'auto_detect' = Auto detect proxy settings
'pac_script' = Use specified PAC script
'fixed_servers' = Manually specify proxy servers
'system' = Use system proxy settings

functions.name: useCustomProxySettings
functions.description: Apply the given proxy configuration.

functions.name: executeCopy
functions.description: Triggers a copy operation in the specified tab.

functions.name: executeCut
functions.description: Triggers a cut operation in the specified tab.

functions.name: executePaste
functions.description: Triggers a paste operation in the specified tab.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides sidebar's mini tab for the specified tab and collapses sidebar if it was in 'active' state (see getState). Has no effect if the sidebar is already hidden.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows sidebar mini tab (in 'shown' state) for the specified tab. Has no effect if already expanded, otherwise changes status to 'shown'.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: expand
functions.description: Expands sidebar and switches to the specified content (if it was displaying another extension's sidebar content) for the specified tab. Extension is allowed to expand sidebar only in response to an explicit user gesture.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: collapse
functions.description: Collapses sidebar for the specified tab. Has no effect if sidebar is not in its 'active' state (see getState).

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: navigate
functions.description: Loads the the specified html file into the sidebar for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

path.description: Relative path to the html file in the extension to show in the sidebar.

functions.name: getState
functions.description: Returns current sidebar state for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
'hidden' indicates sidebar is not defined for the specified tab (show was never called or hide() was called). Nothing is displayed for this sidebar.
'shown' means sidebar is defined for the specified tab; mini tab is displayed for this sidebar. Sidebar UI is either collapsed or displaying a content of some other extension's sidebar.
'active' indicates that sidebar is defined for the specified tab; sidebar UI is expanded and displaying this sidebar's content.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab badge text for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

text.description: The sidebar's badge text. The badge is displayed on top of the sidebar's icon on the mini tab. Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab icon for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

imageData.description: Pixel data for an image to show on the sidebar's mini tab. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element). Only one of the imagePath/imageData parameters all owed. The extension's icon is used by default. The preferred size of the icon is 16x16 pixels, any other size will be scaled to 16x16.

path.description: Relative path to an image in the extension to show on the sidebar's mini tab. Only one of the imagePath/imageData parameters all owed. The extension's icon is used by default. The preferred size of the icon is 16x16 pixels, any other size will be scaled to 16x16.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets sidebar's mini tab title for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

title.description: The sidebar's title. It is displayed in a tooltip over the sidebar's mini tab.

events.name: onStateChanged
events.description: Notifies about sidebar state changes.

types.description: A suggest result.

content.description: The text that is put into the URL bar, and that is sent to the extension when the user chooses this entry.

description.description: The text that is displayed in the URL dropdown. Can contain XML-style markup for styling. The supported tags are 'url' (for a literal URL), 'match' (for highlighting text that matched what the user's query), and 'dim' (for dim helper text). The styles can be nested, eg. <dim><match>dimmed match</match></dim>.

functions.name: sendSuggestions
functions.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.

parameters.description: Array of suggest results

functions.name: setDefaultSuggestion
functions.description: Sets the description and styling for the default suggestion. The default suggestion is the text that is displayed in the first suggestion row underneath the URL bar.

parameters.name: suggestion
parameters.description: A partial SuggestResult object, without the 'content' parameter. See SuggestResult for a description of the parameters.

description.description: The text to display in the default suggestion. The placeholder string '%s' can be included and will be replaced with the user's input.

events.name: onInputStarted
events.description: User has started a keyword input session by typing the extension's keyword. This is guaranteed to be sent exactly once per input session, and before any onInputChanged events.

events.name: onInputChanged
events.description: User has changed what is typed into the omnibox.

parameters.name: suggest
parameters.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.
Array of suggest results

events.name: onInputEntered
events.description: User has accepted what is typed into the omnibox.

events.name: onInputCancelled
events.description: User has ended the keyword input session without accepting the input.

types.description: Information about an icon belonging to an extension or app.

size.description: A number representing the width and height of the icon. Likely values include (but are not limited to) 128, 48, 24, and 16.

url.description: The url for this icon image.

types.description: Information about an installed extension or app.

name.description: The name of this extension or app.

description.description: The description of this extension or app.

version.description: The version of this extension or app.

enabled.description: Whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

isApp.description: True if this is an app.

appLaunchUrl.description: The launch url (only present for apps).

optionsUrl.description: The url for the item's options page, if it has one.

icons.description: A list of icon information. Note that this just reflects what was declared in the manifest, and the actual image at that url may be larger or smaller than what was declared, so you might consider using explicit width and height attributes on img tags referencing these images. See the manifest documentation on icons for more details.

permissions.description: Returns a list of API based permissions.

hostPermissions.description: Returns a list of host based permissions.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Returns a list of information about installed extensions and apps.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Return information about the installed extension or app that has the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID from an item of $ref:ExtensionInfo.

functions.name: setEnabled
functions.description: Enable or disable an app or extension.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an item of $ref:ExtensionInfo.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether this item should be enabled or disabled.

functions.name: uninstall
functions.description: Uninstall a currently installed app or extension.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an item of $ref:ExtensionInfo.

functions.name: launchApp
functions.description: Launches an application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The extension id of the application.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been installed.

events.name: onUninstalled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been uninstalled.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the extension or app that was uninstalled.

events.name: onEnabled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been enabled.

events.name: onDisabled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been disabled

functions.name: install
functions.description: Installs the extension corresponding to the given id

parameters.name: expected_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension to install.

functions.name: beginInstall
functions.description: Initiates the install process for the given extension id

parameters.name: expected_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension to be installled. Must be called during a user gesture.

parameters.name: expected_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension to be installled. This should match a previous call to beginInstall.

functions.name: getBrowserLogin
functions.description: Returns the logged-in sync user login if there is one, or the empty string otherwise.

functions.name: getStoreLogin
functions.description: Returns the previous value set by setStoreLogin, or the empty string if there is none.

functions.name: setStoreLogin
functions.description: Set a preference value with the store login.

functions.name: promptBrowserLogin
functions.description: Causes the browser to bring up the browser login UI.

parameters.name: preferred_email
parameters.description: The email address to use to pre-populate the login dialog (can be an empty string).
